item.title: Steve add a quote by James Wright
item.description: "Suddenly I realize That if I stepped out of my body I would break Into blossom. " -- James Wright

item.title: Steve add a quote by Billy Sunday
item.description: "Going to church doesnâ€™t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile." -- Billy Sunday

item.title: Steve add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "An adventure is only an inconvenience rightly considered. An inconvenience is only an adventure wrongly considered." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Steve add a quote by Thomas de Quincey
item.description: "If once a man indulges himself in murder, very soon he comes to think little of robbing; and from robbing he comes next to drinking and Sabbath-breaking, and from that to incivility and procrastination." -- Thomas de Quincey

item.title: Steve add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "Fairy tales do not tell children the dragons exist. Children already know that dragons exist. Fairy tales tell children the dragons can be killed." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Steve add a quote by Thomas De Quincey
item.description: "Surely everyone is aware of the divine pleasures which attend a wintry fireside; candles at four o'clock, warm hearthrugs, tea, a fair tea-maker, shutters closed, curtains flowing in ample draperies to the floor, whilst the wind and rain are raging audibly without." -- Thomas De Quincey

item.title: Steve add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "There are two ways to get enough. One is to continue to accumulate more and more. The other is to desire less." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Steve add a quote by Alfred Bester
item.description: "Faith in faith' he answered himself. 'It isn't necessary to have something to believe in. It's only necessary to believe that somewhere there's something worthy of belief." -- Alfred Bester
